item.title: Roots damaging driveway, 10th November
item.description:
Outside our house at 23 bramerton road there is a large old cherry tree. The roots can be seen spreading out from the tree . It appears that a root has grown beneath the pavement onto our drive (23) and has lifted the concrete around our manholes. There is quite a bit of damage and it is becoming a trip hazard . Could you get somebody to inspect and hopefully repair the damage

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bramerton Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street Light and Twin Lamp Repairs – Hyde Park Corner (Stop F), 10th November
item.description:
Dear Sir/Madam, Following correspondence with Westminster City Council, I have been advised that the street light near Hyde Park Corner (Stop F), London SW1W 0QH, on Duke of Wellington Place, just beside the bus stop and opposite the Buckingham Palace wall, falls under the jurisdiction of Transport for London (TfL), and that I should report the faulty streetlight to TfL. I would like to remind you that this street light (column number 2) has been out of order for a long time. Additionally, the lamp on one of the twin lights opposite this street light is also not working and requires repair. Please see the attached photo for reference. I would be grateful if both lights could be inspected and repaired as soon as possible. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Duke of Wellington Place, Belgravia, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter around planters on Tabard Street, 10th November
item.description:
Plastic black bags, clothing, and plastic bottles have been left at the planters on Tabard Street for over a week. DESPITE, FixMyStreet indicating that the area has been cleared, these items remain in place.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pilgrimage Street, The Borough, London

item.title: Abandoned Lime bike, 10th November
item.description:
This bike has been in place for more than 48 hours, outside 21 and 22 Park Avenue N3 2EJ Please require Lime to remove their street litter before we do. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Avenue, Fallow Corner, London

item.title: Constant fly tipping of bulky items: furniture etc, 10th November
item.description:
Alleyway between Springhead and Alexandra roads is constantly cluttered with pieces of furniture, construction materials, car parts, trolleys etc. It blocks the driving path to garages and gates. Moreover, as a result of constant fly tipping we have noticed a lot of rats/mice which possess a threat to our health. Despite the fact that we’ve been cleaning the area at our own expense - fly tipping is continued. A more firm decision should be taken to tackle this issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Springhead Road, Slade Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large branch snapped and partly blocking pavement, 10th November
item.description:
A sizeable branch has snapped off the public tree outside the Gaskell Court flats on Green Lane SE20 (near bus stop). It is partially blocking the pavement, is hazardous to visually impaired people and could also end up falling into the road if not removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lane, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet
